Lesson Excerpt This four-minute segment of the SCIENCE RE-
PORTER program on COMPUTER SKETCHPAD
shows the designer drawing various geometric figures with the
light-pen. The computer then indicates, by the image on the
oscilloscope, how the various figures will change as perspective
is changed or dimension is altered. Given a three-dimensional
object, the computer can show how the object will look as seen
from four separate views. Given two three-dimensional objects,
the computer can show on the Sketchpad how these objects will
relate to each other in various visual perspectives and how they
will relate as one passes through and intersects the other.
